intro: Werauhia tiquirensis, commonly known as the Tiquirensis Werauhia, is a species of flowering plant in the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup to collect rainwater. The plant produces striking inflorescences with brightly colored flowers, typically in shades of red, orange, or yellow. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
